name: Greek and Roman Gods
description: Names of Greek and Roman Gods and their dominion(s)

Greek Gods.val: Goddess of love, beauty, desire, sex and pleasure
God of music, arts, knowledge, healing, plague, prophecy, poetry, manly beauty, archery, and the sun
God of war, bloodshed, and violence
Virgin goddess of the hunt, wilderness, animals, young girls, childbirth, plague, and the moon
Goddess of intelligence, skill, peace, warfare, battle strategy, handicrafts, and wisdom
Goddess of grain, agriculture and the harvest, growth and nourishment
God of wine, parties and festivals, madness, chaos, drunkenness, drugs, and ecstasy
King of the underworld and the dead, and god of regret.
Crippled god of fire, metalworking, and crafts
Queen of the gods and goddess of marriage, women, childbirth, heirs, kings, and empires
God of boundaries, travel, communication, trade, language, and writing
Virgin goddess of the hearth, home and chastity
God of the sea, rivers, floods, droughts, and earthquakes.
King and father of the gods, the ruler of Mount Olympus and the god of the sky, weather, thunder, lightning, law, order, and justice

Roman Gods.val: Roman God of the Sky, thunderstorms, lightning, weather, air, law, order, justice, governance and strength
God of War, Spring and Justice
Goddess of Love and consort of Mars
Goddess of War, Conquest and Peace
Goddess of Wisdom, Divine Counsel, Useful Arts and Crafts
God of Beginnings, Endings, Transition, Doorways and Keys
Goddess of the Home and the Hearth
